mdRecord.dcterms:title: Governors' Conference Visiting Washington's Tomb at Mount Vernon, April 28, 1932
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Abbott, Harold T.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photograph of Col. Harrison H. Dodge, Governor Pinchot (PA) and members of the Governors' Conference visit George Washington's Tomb. Colonel Dodge is speaking while on his left Governor Pinchot lowers his head. An excerpt from the 1932 MVLA Minutes (page 46) reads: On April 28th, came twenty-two of the Governors who had been attending the Conference in Richmond. They were led by Governor Pollard of Virginia. After the usual ceremony at the Tomb, laying a handsome floral piece at Washington's bier, and a speech by Governor Pinchot, the next move on the program was to be received at the Mansion by the Regent and shown the "points of interest."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799--Tomb
